Peter, let me just comment that it's great to see your clear 
explanations =
and suggestions regarding HyperNEAT- as authors that 
gives us a good feeli=
ng that our paper communicated effectively.  In 
general I agree with every=
thing you have stated in this thread.

Unfortunately, I'm also somewhat unc=
lear on the main issue with 
which Andy is concerned.  

Andy, like Peter, =
I am also not sure what novel terms 
like "hypercube input topology" mean?
=

Do you mean the CPPN topology changes?  Or do you mean the set of 
inputs =
to the CPPN change?  Or perhaps you mean the inputs defined 
in the substra=
te change over time (e.g. perhaps they change in 
density)?

Looking at all=
 3:

1) The connective CPPN topology indeed changes over the course of 
evo=
lution, so that is happening already and is a standard aspect of 
NEAT.

2)=
 The set of inputs to the CPPN does not currently change.  Like 
Peter, I'm=
 not sure why one would want it to change?  I'm also not 
sure if this is a=
ctually what you are asking about.

3) If you are talking about substrate i=
nputs changing, the question 
is what about them is changing, and why would=
 you want them to 
change?  Are we talking about increasing density?  Or so=
me other 
more fundamental change?

Also, in general there is no problem if=
 the inputs are e.g. in a 3D 
space and the outputs are in a 2D space, so t=
hat isn't anything 
special for the CPPN.  But again, that may not be what =
you're asking.

ken
